p:
The sensitivity or dependence of countries with regard to marine capture fisheries was calculated as an index of five variables: number of fishers ( S
1 ); share of marine fisheries exports in total exports ( S
2 ); percentage of fishers in the economically active population ( S
3 ); weight of total fisheries landings ( S
4 ); and share of marine fish protein in total protein consumption ( S
5 ) ( Fig 1). In line with the previous work of Allison et al. [ 14], values for each variable were first collected from corresponding existing datasets. Next the data were normalized on a scale from 0 to 1, and the five variables were averaged with equal weights. The subsequent aggregate sensitivity variable was then normalized on a scale from 0 to 1 to create the sensitivity index.
